Detailed Description

LCD Screen functions.

The POB-Robotics-Suite comes with a lcd screen with a size of 60 pixels by 8 pixels (width / height).

You can print text to the lcd screen or send directly the pixel values to draw a picture.

Print Text to the LCD.
 #include <pobRoboticSuite.h>

 int main(void)
 {

                // Init the Pob-Robotics-Suite hardware:
                InitCpu();
                InitRobot();

                // Print the text to the LCD Screen:
                SetLCDText("Hello !",7);

                while(1)
                {
                }

                return 0;
 }

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum _scroll_mode_

Scroll's mode.

Enumerator:
SCROLL_MODE_STOP 

Stop after scrolling

SCROLL_MODE_LOOP 

Play in loop the text

SCROLL_MODE_REBOUND 

Rebound the text when reach end of text.

enum _scroll_sens_

Scroll's sens.

Enumerator:
SCROLL_LEFT_RIGHT 

Text go left to right

SCROLL_RIGHT_LEFT 

Text go to right to left

enum _videomode_

Video mode.

Enumerator:
VIDEOMODE_NORMAL 

Normal mode (Black on white)

VIDEOMODE_REVERSE 

Reverse mode (White on black)

void SetLCDScrollParam ( ScrollOption *  option  ) 

Set the option of the LCD scroll.

Parameters:
option A pointer to a valid ScrollOption structure. You have to set parameters of this structure!
Scrolling option example.
 #include <pobRoboticSuite.h>

 int main(void)
 {
    // declare a ScrollOption structure:
    ScrollOption option;

    // init pob-robotics-suite:
    InitCpu();
    InitRobot();

    // set option in the scructure: loop, text go from left to right at speed 2:
    option.mode     = SCROLL_MODE_LOOP;
    option.sens     = SCROLL_LEFT_RIGHT;
    option.speed    = 2;

    // write parameters:
    SetLCDScrollParam(&option);

    // write text to the lcd:
    SetLCDScrollText("Hello from Pob-Robotics-Suite",29);

    // ... and start the scrolling!
    StartLCDScroll();

    while(1)
    {
    }

    return 0;
 }
